put.description:
This API updates Segmented-Audience with given data in the request payload.

### Request Body Details

| **Field** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| groupName | String | Name of the audience |
| dataPartnerId | Number | Selected segments data partner's Id |
| dataPartnerName | String | Selected segments data partner's name |
| equation | String | Selected segments id's equation |
| taxonomyIdList | Array of objects | List of all selected segments objects which contains segments details. |

##### equation:

'equation' represents the selection of the segments.  
Segment's selection is represented with segments ids and few symbols:

**() : parentheses** (Represents a group of selected segment's)  
**& : ampersand symbol** (Represents 'AND' between two segments ids or groups)  
**| : pipe symbol** (Represents 'OR' between two segments ids or groups)

**equation Examples**:  
1\. ( X | Y ):  
2.( ( X | Y ) & ( Z ) )

##### taxonomyIdList :(Fields Description)

| **Field** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | String | Segments' id (UUID) |
| taxonomyValue | String | Segments' taxonomy value |
| cpm | Double | Segments' cpm value |
| value | String | Segments' value |
| description | String | Segments' description |
| pathKey | String | Segments' path key |

##### taxonomyIdList: (Example)

``` json
  {
     "description":"Finance > Bank > ALL",
     "pathKey":"Finance > Bank > ALL",
     "cpm":1.5,
     "id":"bbe1861e-6766-4d48-97a8-9aa39eaaf949",
     "taxonomyValue":"ALL",
     "value":"ALL"
}

```

post.summary: Create Geo-Farmed Audience
post.description:
This API creates new Geo-Farmed Audience with given data in the request payload.

### Request Body Details

| **Field** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| audienceName | String | name of the audience |
| frequency | Number | frequency number |
| frequencyType | integer | frequency type id |
| startDate | Number | start date in long format |
| endDate | Number | end date in long format |
| timezone | Number | timezone id |
| timeRange | String | time range in JSON |
| locations | String | locations in JSON |

##### timeRange :

The timeRange is taken as JSON, it's depicts the days of the week and hours for a particular day.  

##### Example :

``` json
"timeRange": {
        "0": [
            [
                "19:00:00",
                "22:00:00"
            ]
        ],
        "1": [
            [
                "09:00:00",
                "12:00:00"
            ],
            [
                "15:00:00",
                "18:00:00"
            ]
        ],
        "2": [
            [
                "04:00:00",
                "11:00:00"
            ]
        ],
        "4": [
            [
                "06:00:00",
                "12:00:00"
            ]
        ],
        "6": [
            [
                "01:00:00",
                "10:00:00"
            ]
        ]
    },

```

##### locations :

"locations" is taken as JSON, which contains three fileds, "included", "excluded" and "locationFileIds"

where "included" and "excluded" have same structure/fields.

| **Field** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| cities | JSON Array of Integer | Array of city Ids. |
| counties | JSON Array of Integer | Array of county Ids |
| stateSenates | JSON Array of Integer | Array of stateSenate Ids |
| stateHouses | JSON Array of Integer | Array of stateHouse Ids |
| congressionalDistricts | JSON Array of Integer | Array of congressionalDisctrict Ids |
| zipCodes | JSON Array of Integer | Array of ZipCodes |
| customAreas | JSON Array | Array of Objects |
| locationIds | JSON Array | Array of Location ids |

##### Example: include/exclude

``` json
"included": {
            "locationIds":[
                50488,

            ],

            ],

            ],
            "customAreas": [

                    "latitude": 35.406129635621866,
                    "longitude": -78.33474172529601,
```

This API creates new Campaign-Audience with given data in the request payload.

| Field | Type | Description |

| startDate | Number | Start date of the audience in long format |

``` json
            225294,
            225296
        ],
        "clicks": [
            227829
        ],
        "conversions": [
            227974
```

put.summary: Delete the specified audience based on the provided audience update status request.
put.description:
Deletes the specified audience based on the provided audience update status request.
This API validates the logged in user and the audience IDs provided in the request.
The validations are based on the user's access to the audience IDs and whether the audience IDs' are attached to campaigns or not.
If the user is not authorized to delete the audience IDs, it throws a CustomForbiddenException.
If the audience IDs are attached to campaigns, it fails the deletion.
After successful validation, it updates the status of the provided audience IDs to 'Deleted' status.
It returns the response as a ResponseObject containing success IDs and failed IDs - showing that which IDs were successfully set to deleted and which were not.

responseObject.errorMsg: Request body either not provided or not valid.

patch.description:
This API updates campaign. Whichever fields needs to updated only those needs to be sent in request body.

If campaign is in `DRAFT` mode that this api will automatically update status from `DRAFT` to `PENDING`. In all other cases it will not update status.

#### Request Body Detail

| advertiserDomain | String | add domain |
| creativeType | Number | Creative type id |
| campaignType | Number | Campaign type id |

## Get list of conversions with basic details(id, name, isROAS).

Get list of all conversions with "isROAS" field in the response object. "isROAS" is boolean and is true for a conversion only if the conversion has either "conversion value" or "financial metric",This also support pagination, and search by id or name. This API is accessible only by an Advertiser.

### SUPPORTED FEATURES: 
* Pagination. 
* Search by name or id.

| Key |  Sample Value |
| ---------------- | ----------- |

### PARAMS: 


| Key |  Sample Value | Default value |
| ---------------- | ----------- | ----- |
| searchField  | xyz | |
| pageNo  | 2 | -1 | 
| limit  | hpZucdYn66n9PqYkqqJEikiib1J_zC8xmCvCbYF8LA | 10 | 


* If pageNo is set to -1, no pagination will be applied.

patch.description:
This API endpoint allows authorized users to update the details of an existing creative. 
 The creative's attributes can be modified by advertisers, workspaces, or super users. 
 The creative can be updated with a name, external creative ID, rejection reason, and remarks.  
 Additionally, ownership and edit permissions are validated to ensure the request is authorized.

---

#### Request Body Detail

| **Field** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| creativeName | String | Represents name of the creative |
| externalCreativeId | String | Represents 3rd party id |
| creativeRejectionReason | String | Represents reason for rejecting the creative if applicable |
| creativeRemarks | String | Represents remarks to be added for this creative |

post.summary: This API provides list of zip codes.
post.description: Get the list of zip codes with state ids for given filters.

requestBody.description:
#### Request Body Detail

| **Field** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| pageNo `[optional]` | Number | Page number for the required data. The default value is 1. |
| noOfEntries `[optional]` | Number | The maximum number of returned results per page. Default value is 300.|
| sortBy `[optional]` | String | Sort the result set by specific field. For ascending use plus(+) sign(ascii value '%2B') and for descending use minus(-) sign. Sorting supported on `id`, `name` fields.|
| searchField `[optional]` | String | Search the result by provided keyword in the searchField. Search zips by `name` or `id`.|
| ids `[optional]` | Array of Integer | selected zip (segmented id) List, zip (segmented id) with provided ids will be returned first compared to other records. |
| parentSegmentIds `[optional]` | Array of Integer | Filter a list of zip codes based on their associated state id, where the state is considered the parent of each zip code. The state id should be taken from  [states](?path=/Master%20API/getStatesSegmentDetails) |
| segmentIds `[optional]` | Array of Integer | zip list filter by segmented ids. |
| zipCodes `[optional]` | Array of String | zip list filter by zip codes. |

Default value is 1| | noOfEntries | Integer | [Optional] - The maximum number of returned results per page.

post.summary: Save report scheduling event.
post.description:
This API saves the report scheduling event. **Request Body Description:** | **Filed** | **Type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | reportId | Integer | [Required] - This is report Id, event will be created on this report id. | | subscriberEmails | Array of String | [Required] - List of the emails on which the report will be sent. | | fileType | Integer | [Required] - Report file type id. The report will be sent in the selected file format .
sample : [1 - CSV, 2 - XLS]| | deliveryFrequency | Integer | [Required] - Delivery frequency type id for the emails to be sent.
sample : [1 - ONCE, 2 - DAILY, 3 - WEEKLY, 4 - MONTHLY] | | deliveryDay | String | [Required, if deliveryFrequency is not ONCE] - Delivery day to specify the day-time when the report should be sent.
This is related to Delivery frequency.
WEEKLY DELIVERY DAY: ["SUNDAY", "MONDAY", ...]
MONTHLY DELIVERY DAY: ["FIRST", "LAST", "2", "3", ..., "29"]| | eventEndDate | Long | [Required, if deliveryFrequency is not ONCE] - This should be a long, TIME EPOCH in UNIX format, in milliseconds.
This is events end date, Scheduled report will be stopped after the eventEndDate is exceeded | | runningTotalEnabled | Boolean | [Optional] - Flag to indicate if the 'Total' Running is enabled for the report. This flag is supported only with 'Campaign' dimension.
If this is true the start-date for the report duration should be the EARLIEST campaign start date,
so the report-time-period will be from the Earliest-campaign-start-date to the report-end-date | | earliestCampaignStartDate | Long | [Required with runningTotalEnabled as 'true'] - This should be a long, TIME EPOCH in UNIX format, in milliseconds.
This is campaign's EARLIEST start date from the selected campaigns, which will be set as the start date of the report-time-period. |

post.summary: Send User Invitations
post.description: This API can be used by any customer (organization) to send invitations to one or more users by providing user names and emails detail.

post.summary: Validate Invite
post.description:
When any customer or user is invited then an invitation link with a hash will be sent to provided emails. This hash can be validated by this API.

| **Key** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| invitedToWorkspace | Workspace domain to which customer or user is invited. |
| organizationName | New organization name in case of customer invitation hash & if it is user invitation hash then organization name where the user is invited. |
| workspaceDomain | Workspace domain where user or customer is invited. If the customer is invited by a superuser then the workspace domain will be null as the customer will be creating a new workspace. |
| isExpired | Flag to inform if the invitation is expired. |
| isInviteProcessed | Flag to inform if the invitation is processed. |
| isNewUser | Flag to inform is it is a new user. |
| isIHPCustomer | Flag to inform if it is an IHP customer. |
| isInviteCancelled | Flag to inform if the invite is cancelled. |
| isInviteProcessing | Flag to inform if the invite is in processing status. |

get.summary: Retrieves the total count(number of items associate with campaign), dimension-wise id and count of modelled items for a specified campaign
get.description:
This retrieves dimension statistics for a campaign :
Dimension Statistics includes :
     * dimension : Dimension ID (creative, state, city, deal... etc
     * Total count : Total number of entities in a dimension, ex : state : number of status attach to campaign id.
     * Modelled count : Number of entities modelled in a dimension
     * modelledIds : List of modelled entity ids.
Parameters :
         * campaignId : The campaign ID to fetch the total spent for
         * startDate : The start date for the spent
         * endDate : The end date for the spent
Through startDate & endDate we will get total count(target + serve) for campaign.

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: The campaign ID to fetch the dimension statistics

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date(in milliseconds epoch) for the total count

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date(in milliseconds epoch) for the total count

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: List of attributes to be fetched, valid values are : ["totalCount","modelledCount","modelledIds"]

Successfully retrieved of dimension stat.description: Successfully retrieved of dimension statistics with attributes passed ["totalCount","modelledCount","modelledIds"]
